intro: Biscutella intermedia subsp. pauana, commonly known as the Brazilian biscuitroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight pubescence, while its flowers are pale yellow with four petals. The subspecies is notable for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
